text: Phintella parva is a jumping spider species that lives in China, Japan and Korea. The species was originally named Icius parvus by Wanda Wesołowska in 1981, but was transferred to the genus Phintella in 1983 by Jerzy Prószyński and renamed Phintella parva when both sexes were described in 1992. ==References== Category:Salticidae Category:Spiders of Asia Category:Spiders of China Category:Chelicerates of Japan Category:Arthropods of Korea Category:Spiders described in 1981 Category:Taxa named by Wanda Wesołowska
title: Phintella parva
